reviews.review_msg: Will be taking my third course with Faran this spring. One of my favorite and the most caring prof in Geography.
This course is watered down and useless - I got the notes from a previous course and compare. I regret taking this course!!
I like him. He's a super nice guy. His test and labs are manageable. No crazy expectations. I'd take one of his courses again.
Seems ok but dull and boring style of presentation. I am afraid the way this course is taught I will not be well prepared for advanced studies in this area. I will avoid courses taught by this prof.

WOW this course is HARD! those that comment that this is easy course is seriously smart or in the field of Physical Geography or Geology. Those in HUMAN GEOGRAPHY stay away go with Natural Hazards 312 or Bio geography 315 if your in the field of Human Geography

Had her for 311 and 411. Great prof, very enthusiastic helpful and a very very nice person. She is very approachable and helps a lot if you see her in her office hour. The class is a bit on the easy side for a science class but that's in part because she's so good. Highly recommended even for non-science students. One of the best profs at SFU.

She's friendly and helpful; she teaches the labs and will check your answers and tell you if you've gotten something wrong so attend the labs to get hint and answers! Midterm & final reasonable with fill in the blanks, circle the right answer and short answer definitions etc. Textbook just covered exactly what she said so I opened it once.

Jason is a great teacher and interactes with the class with group discussions. Labs were only for completion marks which was sort of nice, but you either got the mark or didn't. Midterms and finals were fair. Study his slides, pay attention in lecture, and understand the labs because they are tested in the lecture midterms and final.

Jason is one of my favourite professors I've had at SFU! While he might be new at teaching, and occasionally has troubles conveying difficult concepts, he more than makes up with it with his enthusiasm for the subject, and his determination make sure you understand. Would definitely recommend!
Jason is a awesome teacher! Really funny and makes class fun, would recommend.

The averages in this course and grading structure is a bit different from a lot of the other courses I've taken (higher), but also ultimately everyone still did fine and it worked out. Our midterm average was 90% I think. Jesse was a good prof and I liked this class

As others mentioned midterm and final only 30 or fewer questions so each one impacts final grad heavily. And grading his scale is bumped higher, but 50% of your grade comes from labs marked for completion. Class average was B+

Jesse did an amazing job adapting to the new online learning format. His youtube videos for this course were very well done and extremely helpful. Having the lab assignments for completion took a lot of the stress away. I do agree that the exams were too short, resulting in individual exam questions heavily impacting your overall course grade.

This is a very average course. The material is not that hard but also not very interesting. Assignments are long and confusing but marked mainly for completion. Exams are very short (1 MC question is 1% of final grade) and Jesses grading scale is challenging with A+ 97%, A 93%, and A- 90%, so there is little room for error.

Avoids him at all costs. Hes extremely picky on his marking and expects you to show EVERY single calculation on his exam. Also, he was extremely rude to me and some other students as well during his office hours and on email responses. Had to meet with other TA to have my questions answered.

Daniel is a nice guy but is not a great prof. He takes forever to go through his 25 slide lectures, and sometimes doesn't even finish them in the 2 hour time frame given. Is a very picky marker and took a mark off my midterm cause I wrote "north hemisphere" not "northern hemisphere". 100/10 would not have him as a prof again.

His exam questions are straightforward and he makes it sound like all of the answers to his exam questions are simple, but will deduct marks for the most absurd things. Don't bother even trying to make a case for yourself because you won't win - he's always right. Waste of money if taught by him. Can learn the same amount online.

Having Daniel is REALLY something. His exams and assignments are actually really easy, but he expects unusual things from students and wants your assignments to look exactly like his answer key, but not too exact or he will think you're cheating. Try to reason with him and he will fight you to death. Don't take classes with him, avoid at all costs.

Will tell you he wants to make you a better student Homework assignments are basic math in a 3rd year university course Extremely picky Gets upset when assignments don't look identical to answer key -but also if they look too much like answer key Asks for feedback, then ignores suggestions Didn't give TA a syllabus Do not take classes with him Run.
